alert.note: Alert for Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Lincoln; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 3:21PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kennebec, northwestern Waldo and southeastern Somerset Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 320 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Fairfield, moving south at 15 mph. Additional thunderstorms could develop across these areas as several outflow boundaries come together. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Augusta, Waterville, Fairfield, Oakland, Pittsfield, Skowhegan, China, Clinton, Belgrade, Liberty, Palermo, Unity, Norridgewock, Benton, Canaan, Albion, Burnham, Freedom, Montville and Smithfield. This includes Interstate 95 between mile markers 113 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Lincoln; Southern Somerset
